DataElement.preferredName: Serological Hematology Hepatitis B Virus Core Antibody Test Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to the serological hematology test, the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens, hepatitis B virus core antibody, an antibody produced by B lymphocytes to the hepatitis B core antigen as part of the immune response to hepatitis B viral infection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Serological Hematology Hepatitis B Virus Core Antibody Test
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the serological hematology test, the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens, hepatitis B virus core antibody, an antibody produced by B lymphocytes to the hepatitis B core antigen as part of the immune response to hepatitis B viral infection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.:Hematology; the branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.
The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Property.preferredName: Hepatitis B Virus Core Antibody Test
Property.preferredDefinition:
An antibody produced by B lymphocytes to the hepatitis B
core antigen as part of the immune response to hepatitis B viral
infection.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: An antibody produced by B lymphocytes to the hepatitis B core antigen as part of the immune response to hepatitis B viral infection.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
